CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 13, 1954, pg. 21, reads: "Jackie Robinson - Bats for Brotherhood - Jackie Robinson, 1954 chairman of the Commission on Community Organizations of the National Conference of Christians and Jews, is undertaking a nation-wide tour building interest in Brotherhood Week, to be celebrated Feb. 21-28. He was in Pittsburgh Monday.  Other stops include Detroit, South Bend, St. Louis, Tulsa and Los Angeles.  Louis A. Radelat, director of the commission, accompanied Jackie.  Committee - Jackie meets local NCCJ Committee on Police Problems.  From Jackie, extreme left, they include: Gaines T. Bradford, Mrs. Daisy Lampkin, Francis C. Shane, Russell L. Bradley, local NCCJ director; the Rev. Charles S. Spivey, Louis C. Stuckrath and Louis A. Radelat."
TitMainTitle: Baseball player Jackie Robinson, Gaines T. Bradford, Daisy Lampkin, Francis C. Shane, Russell L. Bradley, Rev. Charles S. Spivey, Louis C. Stuckrath, and Louis A. Radelat, gathered around table for National Conference of Christians and Jews committee meeting
